title: Ash in the Hollow
text: They called it mercy when the elder burned the fields. Yet the ash drifted like tired snow, and in each flake I heard a name I once knew. The village slept, but the hollow did not; it hummed with a memory too patient to be kind.

title: The Lantern Daughter
text: She wore a lantern where a locket should be. Its light did not chase the dark; it taught the dark how to listen. On the seventh crossing, she learned the road was not a path but a promise, and promises hunger.

title: Prayer of Splinters
text: The chapel had no doors, only wind. We knelt anyway. The floor remembered forests and answered in splinters, each one a psalm. I bled my amen softly, that it might be believed.

title: Grave of the Unasked
text: There is a grave for questions that were never brave enough to become words. The caretaker is kind and will not look at you when you visit. Bring salt. Not for the earth. For your tongue.

title: Witchâ€™s Ledger
text: Her book balanced debts the world pretended not to owe. Names were weighed in breaths, deeds in silences. When she smiled, the pages turned by themselves, as if relieved to be seen.

title: Where Rivers Remember
text: We thought water forgot. We were wrong. The river kept our reflections shelved like glassware, and on late autumn it set the table. We drank what we had been, and left thirsty for what we might yet become.
